parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural

str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From arche and sunagoge; director of the synagogue services.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From a derivative of theaomai; to be a spectator of, i.e. Discern, (experience) or intensively (acknowledge).
(a) din, hubbub, confused noise, outcry, (b) riot, disturbance. From the base of throeo; a disturbance.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To weep, weep for, mourn, lament. Of uncertain affinity; to sob, i.e. Wail aloud.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: From alale; to vociferate, i.e. to wail; figuratively, to clang.
